texts.text: Host privileges are an option exclusive to the Legacy Console Edition, allowing the player to enable or disable the daylight cycle, weather cycle, keep inventory, mob spawning. and mob griefing. Enabling this option deactivates achievements or trophies permanently for this world.

1 World-creating options
1.1 Daylight Cycle
1.2 Weather Cycle
1.3 Keep Inventory
1.4 Mob Spawning
1.5 Mob Griefing
2 In-game options
2.1 Game modes
2.2 Difficulty
2.3 Weather
2.4 Time of day
2.4.1 Day
2.4.2 Night
2.5 Teleportation
2.6 Set World Spawn Point
3 Player Options
3.1 Disable Exhaustion
3.2 Invisibility
3.3 Flying
3.4 Set Player Spawn Point
4 See also
Turns on/off the daylight cycle. Defaults to enabled.
If disabled, the weather does not change. If enabled, the weather changes to clear, rain, thunder, or snowy (in cold biomes). Defaults to enabled.
When enabled, your inventory stays when you die.

If enabled, mobs spawn naturally. If disabled, mobs don't spawn naturally (except for vindicators and evokers in woodland mansions, villagers in villages and elder guardians in ocean monuments). Mobs can still spawn through monster spawners and spawn eggs. Defaults to enabled.

If disabled, mobs don't change blocks. Creeper explosions don't destroy blocks, sheep don't turn grass blocks into dirt by eating it, snow golems don't cover the ground with snow, evokers aren't able to change colors of sheep, and endermen don't pick up blocks. Defaults to enabled.
In game, the host and players set to "moderators" can change all options listed above and below.
The player can change the default and their own gamemode.
The player can change the difficulty.
The player can change the weather into:

Rain
Thunderstorm
Clear
Snow (Only in cold biomes)
The player can change the time of day into day or night.
In multiplayer, the player can teleport to other players.
Pressing the button for world spawn point changes the player's default spawn point.

The host player and players set as moderators can enable/disable this options in the player menu. All players set as moderators must be allowed by the host or other moderator players to enable/disable this options. Moderator players can change this options on other players (except the host).

If enabled, the hunger bar for this player never depletes unless healing and if the hunger bar is empty the player does not take hunger damage. Can be enabled/disabled in all game modes except Creative.
If enabled, allows the player to become fully invisible and invincible.
If enabled, the player can enable/disable flying on all game modes except Creative.
Sets the player's spawn point. If the spawn point set by this command gets obstructed, causes the player to spawn at the world spawn point.

Options
Legacy Console Edition exclusive features
